revised_title: Analysis of a Triple Sulphuret of Lead, Antimony, and Copper from Cornwall
tldr: The author, Charles Hatchett, analyzes a triple sulphuret ore containing lead, antimony, and copper from Cornwall. He compares his findings to the work of Count de Bournon and provides additional information about the composition and properties of the ore. The ore is a triple sulphuret, with lead, antimony, copper, and a small proportion of iron combined with sulfur.
